titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the North West Company Voyageur Contracts
titlestmt.author: Karen Spicher

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Sunday December 9, 2018 at 04:53

did.unittitle: North West Company voyageur contracts

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Forty-four printed contracts completed in manuscript, 1801-1821, between North West Company shareholding firms and voyageurs or laborers. Outfitters and destinations include: M'Tavish, Frobisher & Co., to Grand Portage, Rainy Lake, and Timiskaming, 1801 and 1806; Parker, Gerrard, Ogilvy & Co., to Michilimackinac, 18027; Alexander Mackenzie & Co., to Grand Portage and Rainy Lake, 1802; and M'Tavish, M'Gillivrays & Co., to Fort William, 1808-1821.

bioghist.head: North West Company
bioghist.p: The North West Company, a Canadian fur trading firms based in Montréal, Québec, was founded in the 1770s and merged with the Hudson's Bay Company in 1821. The Company was comprised of shareholding firms who engaged and outfitted voyageurs to transport furs from trading posts in the Canadian Northwest to Montréal.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from William Reese Co. on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana, 2011.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: North West Company Voyageur Contracts. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Forty-four printed contracts completed in manuscript, 1801-1821, between North West Company shareholding firms and voyageurs or laborers. Outfitters and destinations include: M'Tavish, Frobisher & Co., to Grand Portage, Rainy Lake, and Timiskaming, 1801 and 1806; Parker, Gerrard, Ogilvy & Co., to Michilimackinac, 18027; Alexander Mackenzie & Co., to Grand Portage and Rainy Lake, 1802; and M'Tavish, M'Gillivrays & Co., to Fort William, 1808-1821.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Associated material: Davies/Scroggie collection of Canadian fur trade documents (WA MSS S-2357), Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.
